title: 2018년 Eadie 사건
summary: 미국 Nebraska, NE 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Eadie. 판결일: 2018-06-01. 법원: Nebraska Supreme Court.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Rachel EADIE and Jeffrey Blount, Individually and as Parents and Natural Guardians of Their Minor Children, Jaden and Zarah, Appellants, v. LEISE PROPERTIES, LLC, and Certified Properties Management, Inc., Appellees.
**판결일**: 2018-06-01
**법원**: Nebraska Supreme Court
**관할**: Nebraska, NE

**판사**: Cassel, Heavican, Luther, Miller-Lerman, O'Gorman, Per Curiam, Stacy

## 변호인


  James Martin Davis, of Davis Law Office, for appellants.
 , 
  Stephen G. Olson II, Robert S. Keith, and Kristina J. Kamler, Omaha, of Engles, Ketcham, Olson & Keith, P.C., for appellee Leise Properties, LLC.
 , 
  Patrick S. Cooper, David J. Stubstad, and Brandon J. Crainer, Omaha, of Fraser Stryker, P.C., L.L.O., for appellee Certified Property Management, Inc.
 

## 인용

- 300 Neb. 141
- 912 N.W.2d 715

                                          EADIE v. LEISE PROPERTIES
                                              Cite as 300 Neb. 141




                           R achel Eadie    and    Jeffrey Blount,         individually
                           and as parents and natural guardians of their
                             minor children, Jaden and   Zarah, appellants,
                                   v.
                                    Leise Properties, LLC, and Certified
                                  Properties M anagement, Inc., appellees.
                                                 ___ N.W.2d ___

                                        Filed June 1, 2018.     No. S-17-646.

                1.	 Motions to Dismiss: Appeal and Error. An appellate court reviews a
                    district court’s order granting a motion to dismiss de novo, accepting
                    the allegations in the complaint as true and drawing all reasonable infer-
                    ences in favor of the nonmoving party.
                2.	 Negligence. The question whether a legal duty exists for actionable
                    negligence is a question of law dependent on the facts...
